Implementing a "first in, first out" (FIFO) system in your pantry is a great way to ensure that older items are used before they expire or go bad. Here are some suggestions on how to do it effectively:

**1. Store new items behind existing ones:**
When you bring new items into your pantry, store them behind the existing items of the same type. This way, the older items will be in front and more visible, encouraging you to use them first.

**2. Use a "front-facing" storage system:**
Store items with the front label facing outward, making it easy to see the expiration dates or packaging dates. This will help you identify the oldest items at a glance.

**3. Organize by expiration date:**
Group similar items together and arrange them in order of expiration date. This way, you'll always know which items need to be used first.

**4. Use a "use by" or "consume by" label:**
Add a label or sticker to each item with the "use by" or "consume by" date. This will give you a clear reminder of when the item needs to be used.

**5. Create a "use first" shelf or bin:**
Designate a specific shelf or bin for items that are near expiration or need to be used soon. This will help you keep track of these items and ensure they're used before they go bad.

**6. Rotate your stock:**
Regularly rotate your stock to ensure that older items are moved to the front and newer items are stored behind. This is especially important for items like canned goods, which can be stored for a long time.

**7. Keep a "pantry inventory" list:**
Keep a list of the items in your pantry, including the date you purchased them and their expiration dates. This will help you keep track of what you have and what needs to be used soon.

**8. Set reminders:**
Set reminders on your calendar or phone to check your pantry regularly and use items that are approaching their expiration dates.

**9. Use the "one in, one out" rule:**
When you bring a new item into your pantry, remove or use an older item of the same type. This will help maintain a balanced inventory and prevent clutter from building up.

**10. Make it a habit:**
Make checking your pantry and using older items a regular habit. Try to set aside time each week to review your pantry and plan meals around the items that need to be used soon.

By implementing these strategies, you'll be able to maintain a well-organized pantry and ensure that you're using your items before they expire or go bad. Happy pantry organizing!
